info.game_comments: Second segment and first 6 clues of DJ! round only.

(6, 1).clue: Taking a chance on a purchase is like buying "a pig in" this

(3, 2).clue: The roofs of London taxicabs have extra height so gentlemen won't knock these off

(4, 2).clue: Around 1912, popular ones included "the fish walk", "the bunny hug", & "the turkey trot"

(6, 2).clue: You can "keep it under" this or "talk through" it

(3, 3).clue: Most automobile horns beep on this note, 4th of the C scale

(4, 3).clue: In 1926, he declined a Pulitzer Prize for "Arrowsmith"

(6, 3).clue: From ship's whip, not its mouser, comes problem of not having "enough room to swing" this

(3, 4).clue: According to 1980 census, within 5%, the % of all cars in the world that are in the U.S.

(4, 4).clue: Year of Senate Watergate hearings, V.P. Agnew's resignation & the Arab oil embargo

(6, 4).clue: Inscribed on Emile Cove's sanitarium in France, "Every day in every way, I'm..."

(2, 5).clue: Circular horns are sounded to accompany this sport

(3, 5).clue: At $500,000, most expensive custom car was this make & model, made in 1968 for Secret Service

(4, 5).clue: In 1901 J.P. Morgan formed the world's largest steel corporation, U.S. Steel, after buying him out

(5, 5).clue: 1982 satire in which 2 "bland" people spiced up their appetites with a bit of cannibalism

(3, 1).clue: Of running, swimming, & bicycling, the event that's traditionally 1st in triathlon

(6, 1).clue: Area east of Florida where ships & planes are said to disappear in large numbers

(3, 2).clue: Medieval sport in which the bird must be "manned", "broken", & "trained to lure"

(6, 2).clue: Persistent rumor says this bank robber wan't killed outside Biograph Theater in 1934, but went to Mex.

(6, 3).clue: American dance band leader, known for "In the Mood" who disappeared during 1944 air journey
